context_card.general_topic: AI/ML research, code generation, xAI, hackathons, deep learning optimization
context_card.user_persona_tone: technical and enthusiastic, research-focused with collaborative spirit

top_25_reranked_posts.text:
Finally, our preprint is out!

A retrieval-first approach for code generation, with a 0.6B RL-tuned reranker that beats an 8B baseline and runs ~2.5√ó faster. https://t.co/HasZe6ya62

Overdue portfolio refresh.
Simple idea: browse my work in a ChatGPT like interface. 

less scrolling, more answers. https://t.co/QfAhDRU3Kg
got in - let's goo! üöÄ https://t.co/2LRQDznxxX

@kaarelkaarelson @xai I'll be there!
dm if you'd like to team up (i'm unable to DM lol)
@forwarddeploy @xai will we also have an @elonmusk cameo? üëÄ

@cneuralnetwork Good one!

Not nitpicking, but something seems off - it‚Äôs way harder to get speedups on newer models
I‚Äôve been implementing my version too and can‚Äôt get past ~1.02√ó on the Alpaca dataset
Tried your implementation with Qwen3-1.7B and 8B -virtually no speedup anymore ü§î https://t.co/T6TIDJL2LN

@farguney Felt the same! 
Neither Grok 4.1 nor Gemini 3.0 could steer me away from GPT
@freddiev4 @vboykis how different is mid-training from continued-pre-training though?

xAI office is often quite packed. But with today's hackathon start, it's likely 3X more crowded to have so many talented hackers jamming in to BUILD.
Super excited to see this many great builders, let's go build great things together! https://t.co/SYa62ryB9y

RT @chrisparkX: live at xAI hackathon!üìç

over 500 handpicked devs. only a few hours in & many great projects built already. 

1st place win‚Ä¶

BREAKING: Elon Musk joined the xAI Hackathon today to talk with the hackathon attendees building on Grok.

A 24 hour xAI hackathon is underway right now in the SF Bay Area. https://t.co/Q3vYQqXZaH

@djsaunde @UnslothAI Congrats!

Your Git contributions are wild. How do you keep it up and ship so steadily?
RT @GeCoIn2025: The list of accepted papers is now online! A big thank you to all the authors for your contributions and to our PC for thei‚Ä¶
RT @GeCoIn2025: Denis Akhiyarov  is presenting ‚ÄúDeepCodeSeek: Real-Time API Retrieval for Context-Aware Code Generation‚Äù https://t.co/CCqUr‚Ä¶

We are hiring & rapidly grow post-training at xAI! The team is at the frontier of RLHF, agents, and reasoning efficiency‚Äîin just a few months, we climbed from nothing to #2-3 @arena, #1 Search Arena & other tool use benchmarks, #1-2 in creative writing, and are Pareto-optimal on

We're looking for awesome judges for TreeHacks

if you're an ai researcher, successful founder, creator, journalist, senior in tech, etc and wanna meet the brightest students around the world

DM me one sentence why hackers would love to meet you/why you'd like to judge! https://t.co/gCbhpWGMDT

RT @MattNiessner: (1/n)
How to start a deep learning project? 

We use a remarkably streamlined step-by-step process to set up deep learnin‚Ä¶

Looking forward to welcoming hardcore engineers for our @xai hackathon tomorrow, 24h to build the future 

Also hyped to eat the delicious dinner by 3 Michelin star chef Christopher Kostow üôè https://t.co/0ujFe0QGhB
RT @ivanfioravanti: Time to test Mistral Models again. I think we all remember the fine-tune Mistral 7B moment.

Thrilled to share that Alibaba has 146 papers accepted at NeurIPS 2025, covering model training, datasets, foundational research, and inference optimization, one of the highest among tech companies! 

üöÄOur winning paper, "Gated Attention for Large Language Models: Non-linearity, https://t.co/4nfFf2jxoy

Took me 4 days to read this blog, but totally worth it. A great detailed guide to post training. Why aren't many people talking about it. Kudos to @Han_Fang_ @karthikabinav for sharing their thoughts.
https://t.co/SOlJQuHSyG

At NeurIPS in San Diego from today! 
great to catch up with old friends, and happy to chat about multimodal reasoning/ interactive RL environments.

Some of us from Apriel-15B-Thinker team would be around in person as well for ideas and feedback. Pls come chat with us..

@djsaunde @UnslothAI awesome! 
good luck with the new role

I think if you pick a really hard research problem, try to solve it in <8 weeks, blog everything, shoot videos, ship good oss code and repeat it.

you can get hired by a big lab in ~1 year.

remixed_ads.selected_ad:
Autodesk is putting
the Flex in flexibility.
Pay-as-you-go product access
Learn more
AUTODESK ‚Äî Autodesk is putting
the Flex in flexibility.
Pay-as-you-go product access
Learn more
AUTODESK ‚Äî Experience true flexibility with Autodesk's pay-as-you-go product access.

image_analysis.description: A promotional ad for Autodesk Flex featuring a close-up overhead view of a modern white desk workspace with a laptop displaying Autodesk software, coffee mug, headphones, and stylus. Bold overlaid text reads 'Autodesk is putting the Flex in flexibility. Pay-as-you-go product access. Learn more', with the Autodesk logo at the bottom. Subtle repetition of the message appears in the background.
strengths: Clean, professional workspace visual evokes productivity and modern creative work relevant to designers/engineers
Strong punny headline ('Flex in flexibility') is memorable and ties directly to pay-as-you-go benefits
Clear call-to-action 'Learn more' button stands out
High-quality, aspirational imagery with good use of negative space and branding
improvement_suggestions: Remove text duplication/repetition which feels cluttered and unpolished‚Äîstreamline to single headline + CTA

Tailor for technical AI/ML audience by adding subtle tech elements like code terminals, 3D model renders, or ML visualization on the laptop screen to show Autodesk tools in code gen/design optimization workflows
Highlight quantifiable flexibility benefits e.g., 'Scale compute like cloud GPUs‚Äîpay only for what you use' to resonate with research/hackathon efficiency focus
Incorporate enthusiastic, collaborative vibe with elements like shared screens or hackathon-style setups (multiple laptops/devices) to appeal to xAI/hackathon interests
Amp up energy with dynamic visuals (e.g., animated model renders or progress bars) or tech-forward colors (neon accents on black/white) instead of generic office aesthetic
key_elements: Core punny headline and pay-as-you-go messaging
Productive desk setup with laptop as focal point
image_analysis.style_notes: Sleek corporate professional with a calm, flexible mood; high-end minimalist design emphasizing reliability over excitement

rewritten_ads.content:
Autodesk is putting the Flex in flexibility. üöÄ

Pay-as-you-go product access‚Äîsuper handy for scaling your workflow without the commitment.

Learn more üëÄ

![Autodesk Flex Ad](https://imgen.x.ai/xai-imgen/xai-tmp-imgen-f5056d90-839f-4554-b4f8-42a647e7a16a.png)
rewritten_ads.image_prompt: Clean, modern overhead view of a packed hacker workspace during an AI hackathon: two laptops side-by-side on a white desk, one screen showing Autodesk software with a 3D model render and subtle code terminal open for design optimization, the other with a progress bar and ML viz; scattered stylus, coffee mug, headphones, and shared notes. Energetic tech vibe with neon blue accents on black/white scheme, collaborative feel like team brainstorming. Overlay bold punny text 'Autodesk is putting the Flex in flexibility. Pay-as-you-go product access.' with prominent 'Learn more' button and Autodesk logo at bottom. High-quality, aspirational productivity shot with negative space, no clutter or duplication.
rewritten_ads.enhancement_notes: Builds on original's productive desk + laptop focus and punny headline/CTA strengths by streamlining to single message (no repetition), adding subtle AI/ML hackathon elements like code terminal + 3D render on screen for technical relevance, collaborative multi-laptop setup for team energy, and vibrant neon accents for enthusiastic xAI-style hype‚Äîkeeps it truthful, professional, and aspirational without exaggeration.

ctr_comparison.winner_reasoning: Enhanced variant directly features Autodesk software with 3D models, charts, and neon 'Flex' accents aligning perfectly with ad copy's flexibility theme; high visual appeal, relevance to scaling workflows, and resonates with tech-savvy users via professional setup‚Äîstrongest CTR potential.

all_scores.reasoning: Enhanced variant directly features Autodesk software with 3D models, charts, and neon 'Flex' accents aligning perfectly with ad copy's flexibility theme; high visual appeal, relevance to scaling workflows, and resonates with tech-savvy users via professional setup‚Äîstrongest CTR potential.

Original variant shows a generic workspace with laptop but lacks direct Autodesk product visuals like 3D models or software interfaces; moderate relevance to technical workflow scaling but low visual excitement and emotional pull for AI/ML users focused on code/research over design tools.

Autodesk Flex: True flexibility with pay-as-you-go product access.

rewritten_ads.image_prompt: Clean, modern overhead view of a productive tech workspace tailored for AI/ML engineers and designers: central laptop screen showing Autodesk software with 3D model renders and subtle code terminal integration for design optimization workflows, surrounded by a stylus, coffee mug, headphones, and a second device for collaborative hackathon-style sharing. Energetic yet professional vibe with neon accent highlights on black/white desk surface, ample negative space. Bold overlaid text: 'Autodesk Flex: Pay-as-you-go product access. Learn more.' Autodesk logo at bottom. High-res, aspirational, no clutter or duplication‚Äîevokes efficient, flexible building like xAI hackathons.
rewritten_ads.enhancement_notes: Builds on original's clean desk setup and punny flex messaging by streamlining text to single headline+CTA (removes repetition), adds subtle AI/ML-relevant elements like code terminal and 3D renders on laptop for research/hackathon audience resonance without misleading claims, amps collaborative energy with extra device while preserving professional productivity focus and branding.

ctr_comparison.winner_reasoning: Enhanced variant excels with dual monitors displaying code and vibrant 3D model, directly aligning with user's code generation, optimization, and design workflow interests; high visual appeal, tech relevance, and üöÄ synergy boost resonance for research-focused devs.

all_scores.reasoning: Enhanced variant excels with dual monitors displaying code and vibrant 3D model, directly aligning with user's code generation, optimization, and design workflow interests; high visual appeal, tech relevance, and üöÄ synergy boost resonance for research-focused devs.

Original variant shows a clean workspace appealing to designers but lacks strong tech/dev visuals like code or 3D models; moderate relevance to user's AI/ML interests, good flexibility messaging but lower visual dynamism and emotional pull for a technical audience.

Pay-as-you-go product access. Learn more üöÄ' with clean Autodesk logo at bottom; professional yet collaborative, productivity-focused composition with good negative space, no clutter or duplication, tailored for technical AI researchers and builders.
rewritten_ads.enhancement_notes: Builds on original's clean professional workspace and punny headline strengths by streamlining to single headline+CTA (removes duplication), amps energy for tech/AI audience with hackathon-style multi-device setup, code/3D renders on laptop screen tying to code gen/design interests, neon accents for research-enthusiast vibe, dynamic progress elements without exaggeration‚Äîkeeps truthful focus on pay-as-you-go flexibility.

ctr_comparison.winner_reasoning: Enhanced variant excels with dual monitors displaying code and 3D modeling (Autodesk-relevant), hackathon neon vibe, and dynamic setup aligning perfectly with user's xAI hackathons, code gen, and optimization interests; high visual appeal, relevance, and üöÄ excitement.

all_scores.reasoning: Enhanced variant excels with dual monitors displaying code and 3D modeling (Autodesk-relevant), hackathon neon vibe, and dynamic setup aligning perfectly with user's xAI hackathons, code gen, and optimization interests; high visual appeal, relevance, and üöÄ excitement.

Original variant shows a generic workspace setup that's visually clean but lacks tech-specific elements like code or 3D models; moderate relevance to user's AI/ML workflow but low emotional resonance and hackathon energy for this research enthusiast.
